title: ICE: `cannot relate region: LUB(ReErased, ReError)`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: E-needs-test
labels.description: Call for participation: writing correctness tests

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: S-has-mcve
labels.description: A Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example has been found for this issue

body:
### Code ```Rust #![crate_type = "lib"] #![feature(adt_const_params, generic_const_exprs)] struct Changes where [(); CHANGES.len()]:, {} impl Changes where [(); CHANGES.len()]: {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (171693274 2023-03-14) binary: rustc commit-hash: 1716932743a7b3705cbf0c34db0c4e070ed1930d commit-date: 2023-03-14 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.7 ``` ### Error output ``` error[E0637]: `&` without an explicit lifetime name cannot be used here --> treereduce.out:4:31 | 4 | struct Changes | ^ explicit lifetime name needed here error[E0637]: `&` without an explicit lifetime name cannot be used here --> treereduce.out:8:21 | 8 | impl Changes where [(); CHANGES.len()]: {} | ^ explicit lifetime name needed here error[E0637]: `&` without an explicit lifetime name cannot be used here --> treereduce.out:8:23 | 8 | impl Changes where [(); CHANGES.len()]: {} | ^ explicit lifetime name needed here warning: the feature `adt_const_params` is incomplete and may not be safe to use and/or cause compiler crashes --> treereduce.out:2:12 | 2 | #![feature(adt_const_params, generic_const_exprs)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #95174 for more information = note: `#[warn(incomplete_features)]` on by default warning: the feature `generic_const_exprs` is incomplete and may not be safe to use and/or cause compiler crashes --> treereduce.out:2:30 | 2 | #![feature(adt_const_params, generic_const_exprs)] | ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ | = note: see issue #76560 for more information ```
Backtrace
